original: dper na srog gi dbang po mchis na dbang po gzhan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na srog gi dbang po mchis na dbang po gzhan rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when the faculty of life force is present, the other faculties occur.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du snying rje chen po mchis na byang chub par byed pa'i chos gzhan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du snying rje chen po mchis na byang chub par byed pa'i chos gzhan rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Blessed One, in the same way, when great compassion is present, the other factors that lead to enlightenment occur.

original: /'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: /'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Aksayamati Sūtra,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is like this:

original: dper na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni /
analyzed: dper na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa ni /
translated: exhalation and inhalation

original: skyes bu'i srog gi dbang po'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i srog gi dbang po'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: are the prerequisites for a person’s life force.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po bsgrub pa'i snying rje chen po yang sngon du 'gro ba'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po bsgrub pa'i snying rje chen po yang sngon du 'gro ba'o ;
translated: In the same way, great compassion is the prerequisite for a bodhisattva’s practice of the Great Way.

original: / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na tshong dpon nam khyim bdag bu gcig pa la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na tshong dpon nam khyim bdag bu gcig pa la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as a merchant or householder loves his only son with all his heart,

original: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po la gnas pa yang sems can thams cad la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po la gnas pa yang sems can thams cad la snying thag pa nas sdug par 'dzin pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The bodhisattva who is established in great compassion also holds all sentient beings dear from the bottom of his heart.

original: 'di ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one cultivate compassion?

original: rang gis sngon myong ba dang myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pa rnam pa du ma rang gis shin tu mi 'dod pa bsgoms te /🔽byams pa dang ldan pas sdug pa la sogs pa la byams pa bzhin du bsgom par bya ba'am da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa rnams dang sdug bsngal chen po'i rgya mtsho 'khor ba yun ring po dus tshigs med pa na sdug bsngal dang ldan pa
analyzed: rang gis sngon myong ba dang myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pa rnam pa du ma rang gis shin tu mi 'dod pa bsgoms te / byams pa dang ldan pas sdug pa la sogs pa la byams pa bzhin du bsgom par bya ba'am da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nyen pa rnams dang sdug bsngal chen po'i rgya mtsho 'khor ba yun ring po dus tshigs med pa na sdug bsngal dang ldan pa
translated: One should cultivate the many kinds of suffering and fear that one has experienced and will experience, which are extremely undesirable.🔽One should cultivate compassion for those who are presently suffering, as if they were dear ones, and so on, or for those who are suffering in the great ocean of suffering, in cyclic existence, which is without beginning or end.

original: rnams la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate compassion for those who are suffering in the hells and so on.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: As it is said in the noble Sūtra on the Ten Stages:

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “He thinks as follows:

original: kye ma'o byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag ni mi shes pa rmongs pa dag ste /
analyzed: kye ma'o byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag ni mi shes pa rmongs pa dag ste /
translated: Alas! These childish ordinary beings are ignorant and confused.

original: de dag gi lus grangs med pa 'gags la 'gag par 'gyur zhing 'gag bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag gi lus grangs med pa 'gags la 'gag par 'gyur zhing 'gag bzhin te /
translated: Their countless bodies have ceased, are ceasing, and will cease.

original: de ltar mchi yang lus la yid 'byung ba mi skyed cing /
analyzed: de ltar mchi yang lus la yid 'byung ba mi skyed cing /
translated: Even though they are like that, they do not develop renunciation for the body.

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'khrul 'khor je bas je 'phel du byed /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'khrul 'khor je bas je 'phel du byed /
translated: They increase the machine of suffering more and more.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyud las mi ldog phung po'i gnas mi 'dor //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyud las mi ldog phung po'i gnas mi 'dor //
translated: They do not turn away from the continuum of saṃsāra. They do not abandon the abode of the aggregates.

original: khams kyi sbrul dag gis skyo bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: khams kyi sbrul dag gis skyo bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They are not disgusted by the snakes of the elements.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyis rmongs pa rtogs par mi byed /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyis rmongs pa rtogs par mi byed /
translated: They are confused by the desire for pleasure. They do not realize.

original: skye mched kyi grong stong pa la mi lta /
analyzed: skye mched kyi grong stong pa la mi lta /
translated: They do not see the empty town of the sense bases.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i phra rgyas mi spong /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i phra rgyas mi spong /
translated: They do not abandon the subtle habitual tendencies of grasping “I” and grasping “mine.”

original: nga rgyal dang lta ba'i zug rdu mi 'byin /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang lta ba'i zug rdu mi 'byin /
translated: They do not extract the thorns of pride and views.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe @158b sdang dang gti mug gi me lce 'bar ba zhi bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe @158b sdang dang gti mug gi me lce 'bar ba zhi bar mi byed /
translated: They do not extinguish the blazing flames of desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa mi sel /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa mi sel /
translated: They do not dispel the darkness of ignorance.

original: sred pa'i rgya mtsho mi skems /
analyzed: sred pa'i rgya mtsho mi skems /
translated: They do not dry up the ocean of craving.

original: stobs bcu'i ded dpon yongs su mi tshol zhing bdud kyi bsam pa thibs po'i rjes su song ba ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i ded dpon yongs su mi tshol zhing bdud kyi bsam pa thibs po'i rjes su song ba ste /
translated: They do not seek out the captain who has the ten powers, and they follow the thick thoughts of Māra.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pas yongs su g-yengs pa ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi chu srin 'dzin khris dkrugs pas yongs su g-yengs pa ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: They are distracted by the churning of the ocean of saṃsāra, by the crocodiles of the various thoughts.

original: ma la bdag gis sems can de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa /🔽mgon med pa /🔽dpung gnyen med pa /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis sems can de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa / mgon med pa / dpung gnyen med pa /
translated: “Alas! I will be the one for those sentient beings who are tormented by suffering,🔽who are without a protector,

original: skyabs med pa /🔽gnas med pa /🔽gzhi med pa /
analyzed: skyabs med pa / gnas med pa / gzhi med pa /
translated: who are without a defender,🔽who are without a refuge,🔽who are without a support,🔽who are without a basis,

original: rten med pa /
analyzed: rten med pa /
translated: who are without a foundation,

original: long bar gyur pa /
analyzed: long bar gyur pa /
translated: who are blind,

original: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang spris g-yogs pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs dang spris g-yogs pa /
translated: who are covered by the shell of ignorance,🔽who are overcome by darkness.

original: mun pas zil gyis non pa de dag gi don du gcig pu gnyis su med par gyur nas /
analyzed: mun pas zil gyis non pa de dag gi don du gcig pu gnyis su med par gyur nas /
translated: I will be the one for them, without a second,🔽and I will gather the accumulations of merit and wisdom in such a way that those sentient beings will attain complete purity,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba rnam pa ji lta bus sems can de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya ba rnam pa ji lta bus sems can de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa 'thob par 'gyur ba nas /
translated: and so on up to

original: stobs bcu'i stobs kyis ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyi mthar thug pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs kyis ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyi mthar thug pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya'o //
translated: I will gather the accumulations of merit and wisdom in such a way that I will attain the culmination of the ten powers, up to the absence of attachment of wisdom.

original: yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: And the same text says,

original: kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni 'khor ba'i mya ngan gyi lam du zhugs pa /
analyzed: kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni 'khor ba'i mya ngan gyi lam du zhugs pa /
translated: “Alas, these sentient beings have entered the path of misery of cyclic existence.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro'i gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa /
translated: They are headed for the abyss of the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.🔽They have entered the dangerous thicket of the web of bad views.

original: lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba nyam nga bar zhugs pa gti mug gi thibs pos kun nas yog pa /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba nyam nga bar zhugs pa gti mug gi thibs pos kun nas yog pa /
translated: They are enveloped in the darkness of delusion.

original: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa /
analyzed: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the wrong path.

original: ldongs par gyur pa /
analyzed: ldongs par gyur pa /
translated: They are blind.

original: yongs su 'dren pa med pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa med pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They have no guide.🔽”

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: 'khor ba rgyun gyis bdas pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba rgyun gyis bdas pa /
translated: They are carried away by the current of cyclic existence.

original: srid pa'i klung du zhugs pa /
analyzed: srid pa'i klung du zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the river of existence.

original: shugs drag pos bdas te blta ba'i mthu med pa 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa mang po'i rjes su zhugs pa /
analyzed: shugs drag pos bdas te blta ba'i mthu med pa 'dod pa dang gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa mang po'i rjes su zhugs pa /
translated: They are carried away by the force of the current and have no power to look around. They are caught up in the many thoughts of desire, ill will, and violence.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba chu srin chen pos zin pa /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba chu srin chen pos zin pa /
translated: They are seized by the great sea monster of the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'dod pa thibs po'i klong du zhugs pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa thibs po'i klong du zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the realm of the thicket of desire.

original: dga' ba can dang 'dod chags kyi dkyil du kun du thogs pa /
analyzed: dga' ba can dang 'dod chags kyi dkyil du kun du thogs pa /
translated: They are caught up in the midst of pleasure and passion.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi thang la 'khyams pa /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi thang la 'khyams pa /
translated: They wander in the plain of pride, thinking “I am.”

original: dpung gnyen med pa /
analyzed: dpung gnyen med pa /
translated: They have no protector.

original: skye mched kyi grong nas ma 'phags pa /
analyzed: skye mched kyi grong nas ma 'phags pa /
translated: They have not left the city of the sense-spheres.

original: sgrol ba la mkhas pa dang bral bar gyur pa yin gyi /🔽de dag bdag gis snying @159a * //
analyzed: sgrol ba la mkhas pa dang bral bar gyur pa yin gyi / de dag bdag gis snying @159a * //
translated: They are without skill in liberation.

original: rje chen po dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis bton te /
analyzed: rje chen po dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis bton te /
translated: I will rescue them with great compassion and the power of wholesome actions.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gling 'tshe ba med pa rdul med pa 'jigs pa dang skrag pa thams cad med pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i gling 'tshe ba med pa rdul med pa 'jigs pa dang skrag pa thams cad med pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the island of omniscience, which is free from danger, free from dust, and free from all fear and terror.”

original: kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa mang po mang ba /
analyzed: kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa mang po mang ba /
translated: Alas! These sentient beings are afflicted with much suffering, unhappiness, and turmoil.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang 'brel pa /
translated: They are bound to the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su rgyu ba /
analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang bcas pa'i rjes su rgyu ba /
translated: They are engaged in the pursuit of sorrow and lamentation.

original: sred pa'i sgrog tu bcug /
analyzed: sred pa'i sgrog tu bcug /
translated: They are chained in the prison of craving.

original: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa'i thibs pos kun nas khebs pa yin gyi /🔽de dag bdag gis khams gsum pa'i gnas thams cad la dben pa /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ma rig pa'i thibs pos kun nas khebs pa yin gyi / de dag bdag gis khams gsum pa'i gnas thams cad la dben pa /
translated: They are completely covered by the darkness of ignorance in the three realms.🔽I will lead them to the state of complete peace, which is free from all the abodes of the three realms.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu dgod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: I will lead them to nirvana.🔽In this way, their merit will increase.🔽The merit of those who are diligent,

original: de ltar brtson pa dang bsam pa dang snying rje gcig gis gcig brtan par byas pa de dag gi bsod nams mngon par spel pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa dang bsam pa dang snying rje gcig gis gcig brtan par byas pa de dag gi bsod nams mngon par spel pa rtsom mo //
translated: who have the intention, and who have compassion for each other🔽will increase.

original: de la re zhig bzang po spyod pa'i cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: de la re zhig bzang po spyod pa'i cho ga bzhin //
translated: The ritual for the good conduct

original: phyag 'tshal la sogs gus par bya ;
analyzed: phyag 'tshal la sogs gus par bya ;
translated: is to respectfully perform prostrations and so forth.

original: / drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: / drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
translated: As it says in the Sutra Requested by Ugra:

original: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du /
analyzed: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du /
translated: Three times each day and three times each night,

original: gtsang ba dang gos gtsang ma bgos te phung po gsum pa bklag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtsang ba dang gos gtsang ma bgos te phung po gsum pa bklag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: one should recite the Three Heaps, having purified oneself and put on clean clothes.

original: de la phung po gsum ni sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas la bskul ba zhes bya ba ste bsod nams kyi phung po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phung po gsum ni sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas la bskul ba zhes bya ba ste bsod nams kyi phung po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Three Heaps are the confession of evil, rejoicing in merit, and requesting the Buddhas to teach; they are called heaps because they are heaps of merit.

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni sdig pa bshags pa'i nang du 'dus te sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas sdig pa bshags so zhes nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni sdig pa bshags pa'i nang du 'dus te sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas sdig pa bshags so zhes nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, homage is included in the confession of evil, because the Upalipariprﬁccha-sutra teaches: “Having paid homage to the Buddha, one confesses one’s evil.

original: gsol ba gdab pa ni bskul ba dang don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa ni bskul ba dang don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” Requesting is the same as requesting the Buddhas to teach.

original: mchod pa ni 'byor pa med pa'i phyir mi rtag pas ma smos so //
analyzed: mchod pa ni 'byor pa med pa'i phyir mi rtag pas ma smos so //
translated: Worship is not mentioned because one has no wealth to offer.

original: yid dang ngag ni mdo sde gzhan las grags pa'i phyir ma bshad de //
analyzed: yid dang ngag ni mdo sde gzhan las grags pa'i phyir ma bshad de //
translated: Mind and speech are not mentioned because they are well known from other sūtras.

original: tshig gsum ni gtso bo yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gsum ni gtso bo yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the three phrases are the most important.

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba ni sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The homage is like Homage to all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa dang / ji ltar ston pa'i bstod pa dang / bzang po spyod pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pa dang / ji ltar ston pa'i bstod pa dang / bzang po spyod pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis so //
translated: It is also with the four verses, with the verses of praise to the Teacher, and with the verses of the Bhadracaryā, etc.

original: mchod pa ni 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /🔽rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' @159b me tog gi rnam pa'am 'bras bu'i rnam pa nga yir bya ba med pa yongs su gzung ba med pa gang yin pa de rnams nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la
analyzed: mchod pa ni 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin gyi mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste / rigs kyi bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' @159b me tog gi rnam pa'am 'bras bu'i rnam pa nga yir bya ba med pa yongs su gzung ba med pa gang yin pa de rnams nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la
translated: The offering is as taught in the noble Cloud of Jewels Sūtra:

original: 'bul lo // dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: 'bul lo // dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Here, noble sir, a bodhisattva, three times each day and night, should offer to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas whatever flowers, fruits, or leaves are not owned by anyone, are not possessed, and dedicate that wholesome action to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: de bdug pa'i shing ngam spos kyi shing ngam rin po che'i shing ngam dpag bsam gyi shing ngam me tog gi shing ngam 'bras bu'i shing nga yir bya ba med pa yongs su gzung ba med pa gang yin pa de lta bu de dag kyang nyin lan gsum
analyzed: de bdug pa'i shing ngam spos kyi shing ngam rin po che'i shing ngam dpag bsam gyi shing ngam me tog gi shing ngam 'bras bu'i shing nga yir bya ba med pa yongs su gzung ba med pa gang yin pa de lta bu de dag kyang nyin lan gsum
translated: Those trees that are incense trees, or perfume trees, or precious trees, or wish-fulfilling trees, or flower trees, or fruit trees, which are not owned and are not possessed, three times each day

original: mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'bul lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'bul lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and three times each night, I offer to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: dam tshig gsum bkod pa'i rgyal po las kyang thang las skyes pa'i rin po che'i rnams dang chu las skyes pa'i rin po che'i ri rnams dang thang las skyes pa'i rin po che la sogs pa phyogs bcu na rnams par gnas pa nga yir bya ba med pa
analyzed: dam tshig gsum bkod pa'i rgyal po las kyang thang las skyes pa'i rin po che'i rnams dang chu las skyes pa'i rin po che'i ri rnams dang thang las skyes pa'i rin po che la sogs pa phyogs bcu na rnams par gnas pa nga yir bya ba med pa
translated: And the Tri-samaya-raja says, “I offer the precious things that grow on land and the precious things that grow in the water, and the precious things that grow on land, and so forth, wherever they are found in the ten directions, which are not owned

original: yongs su gsung ba med pa rnams 'bul lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yongs su gsung ba med pa rnams 'bul lo zhes gsungs so //

original: gshegs pa'i mchod rten 'phang du 'di lta ste /🔽ri'i rgyal po ri rab lta bu byed la de dag la yang so so nas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par bsti stang bya ba thams cad kyis bsti stang byed pa bas byang chub sems dpa' gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang
analyzed: gshegs pa'i mchod rten 'phang du 'di lta ste / ri'i rgyal po ri rab lta bu byed la de dag la yang so so nas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par bsti stang bya ba thams cad kyis bsti stang byed pa bas byang chub sems dpa' gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang
translated: If all the sentient beings belonging to the three worlds were to make a Tathāgata shrine for each of them,🔽as high as Mount Meru, and to honor them all with all forms of honor for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: ma bral bas me tog gcig 'dor na /
analyzed: ma bral bas me tog gcig 'dor na /
translated: and if a bodhisattva, not divorced from the thought of omniscience, were to cast a single flower,

original: de ni bsod nams kyi phung po snga ma bas bsod nams ches mang du bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams kyi phung po snga ma bas bsod nams ches mang du bskyed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: the latter would generate merit vastly greater than the former.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par gyur la /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par gyur la /
translated: Suppose all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm were to enter the Great Vehicle,

original: thams cad 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: and each of them were to possess the dominion of a universal monarch.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po re res kyang mar me'i snod rgya mtsho chen po tsam byas te /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po re res kyang mar me'i snod rgya mtsho chen po tsam byas te /
translated: And suppose each of those universal monarchs were to make a vessel for a butter lamp the size of the great ocean,

original: ri rab tsam gyi mar me'i snying pos mar me bus la /
analyzed: ri rab tsam gyi mar me'i snying pos mar me bus la /
translated: and light a wick the size of Mount Meru,

original: so so nas de lta bu'i mar me'i mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rnams la mchod pa bas /
analyzed: so so nas de lta bu'i mar me'i mchod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten rnams la mchod pa bas /
translated: and each of them were to make offerings to the stūpas of the Tathāgatas with such offerings of butter lamps.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas 'byung ba gang gis mar me'i snying po 'bru mar gyis bskus te de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyi drung du 'dzin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas 'byung ba gang gis mar me'i snying po 'bru mar gyis bskus te de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gyi drung du 'dzin na /
translated: But if a bodhisattva who has gone forth from the home life were to hold up a wick soaked in sesame oil in front of a stūpa of the Tathāgata,

original: ras 'bru mar gyis bskus pa'i mar me 'di la snga ma'i mar me phul ba des brgya'i char yang mi phod pa nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: ras 'bru mar gyis bskus pa'i mar me 'di la snga ma'i mar me phul ba des brgya'i char yang mi phod pa nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do //
translated: This lamp of cotton soaked in oil is not even a hundredth part of the lamp offered before, and so on up to: it is not even a cause.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la bde bar sbyar ba thams cad kyis phu dud byed pa bas /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la bde bar sbyar ba thams cad kyis phu dud byed pa bas /
translated: Compared to the service rendered to the Buddha and the community of monks by those universal monarchs with all the comforts,

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ba gang gis bsod snyoms blangs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ba gang gis bsod snyoms blangs te /
translated: the alms-food taken by a Bodhisattva who has gone forth from the home life

original: lhung bzed du chud pa de bzhin dag dang bgo bsha' byas te zan de ni de bas ches mang zhing ches rin che'i //
analyzed: lhung bzed du chud pa de bzhin dag dang bgo bsha' byas te zan de ni de bas ches mang zhing ches rin che'i //
translated: and shared in common is much more, and of much greater value.

original: gang yang rgyal po chen po dag gis ri rab tsam gyi gos kyi phung po sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la phun ba bas /
analyzed: gang yang rgyal po chen po dag gis ri rab tsam gyi gos kyi phung po sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la phun ba bas /
translated: And compared to the heap of robes the size of Mount Meru offered by those great kings to the Buddha and the community of monks,

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ba gang gis phyi rol du byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par byung ba gang gis phyi rol du byung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has gone forth from the home life, having gone outside,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la chos gos gsum phul na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la chos gos gsum phul na /
translated: if he offers three Dharma robes to the saṅgha of monks who have entered the Great Vehicle, beginning with the Buddha, and to a stūpa of the Tathāgata,

original: dge slong gi chos gos byin pa 'dis gos sbyin pa snga ma de zil gyis non par @168b 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: dge slong gi chos gos byin pa 'dis gos sbyin pa snga ma de zil gyis non par @168b 'gyur ro ;
translated: by this gift of Dharma robes to the monks, that previous gift of clothing is surpassed.

original: / yang rgyal po de dag re res 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad me tog gis mdzes par byas te /
analyzed: / yang rgyal po de dag re res 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad me tog gis mdzes par byas te /
translated: Moreover, if each of those kings were to beautify the entire Rose Apple Continent with flowers

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la phul ba bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la phul ba bas /
translated: and offer it to a stūpa of the Tathāgata,

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas byung ba gang gis tha na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la me tog gcig phul na sbyin pa 'di la sbyin pa snga ma bas des brgya'i char yang mi phod pa nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi phod do zhes
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim gyi gnas nas byung ba gang gis tha na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la me tog gcig phul na sbyin pa 'di la sbyin pa snga ma bas des brgya'i char yang mi phod pa nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi phod do zhes
translated: but a bodhisattva who has gone forth from the home life were to offer even just one flower to a stūpa of the Tathāgata, this gift surpasses the previous gift by a hundred times, and so on up to: it does not even bear comparison.

original: gsungs so // mthar gyis yang dag par 'phags pa'i le'u las kyang bstan te /
analyzed: gsungs so // mthar gyis yang dag par 'phags pa'i le'u las kyang bstan te /
translated: The Chapter on the Stages of Awakening also teaches this:

original: phan yon bzang po bzhi po 'di dag mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa la spro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phan yon bzang po bzhi po 'di dag mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa la spro bar 'gyur te /
translated: Seeing these four excellent benefits, bodhisattvas delight in making offerings to the Tathāgatas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: bdag gis sbyin gnas kyi mchog la mchod pa byas par 'gyur ba dang / bdag mthong nas gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du slob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pas byang chub kyi sems brtan par 'gyur ba dang / mngon sum du mthong bas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin gnas kyi mchog la mchod pa byas par 'gyur ba dang / bdag mthong nas gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du slob par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pas byang chub kyi sems brtan par 'gyur ba dang / mngon sum du mthong bas skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are: making offerings to the supreme object of offering; others training in that way after seeing me; the awakening mind becoming stable through making offerings to the Tathāgata; and the roots of virtue for attaining the thirty-two marks of a great being being gathered through direct perception.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go zhes so //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go zhes so //
translated: These are the four.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa bla na med pa ste /
translated: This is the unsurpassed way of making offerings and serving the Tathāgatas.

original: blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtshos zhus pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As it says in the Sūtra of the Questions of Sāgaramati:

original: blo gros rgya mtsho gsum po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho gsum po 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa dang rim gro byed pa bla na med pa'o //
translated: “Sāgaramati, these three are the unsurpassed worship and service of the Tathāgata.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: gang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang sems can rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gang dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang sems can rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are the generation of the mind of awakening, the upholding of the sublime Dharma, and the generation of great compassion for sentient beings.”

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang bstan te /
translated: The noble Cloud of Jewels also teaches,

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos bcu dang ldan na mngal gyi dri mas mi gos par skye'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' chos bcu dang ldan na mngal gyi dri mas mi gos par skye'o //
translated: “Child of a good family, bodhisattvas who have ten qualities are born unstained by the womb’s impurity.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs byed pa dang / mchod rten zhig pa 'chos pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la spos kyi byug pa 'bul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs dag la khrus kyi spos chu 'bul ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs byed pa dang / mchod rten zhig pa 'chos pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la spos kyi byug pa 'bul ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs dag la khrus kyi spos chu 'bul ba dang /
translated: making images of the Tathāgata, repairing stūpas that have fallen into ruin, offering incense to stūpas of the Tathāgata, offering perfumed water for bathing the images of the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la phyag ngar dang skyang nul bya ba 'bul ba dang / pha ma la lus kyi rim gro byed pa dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dag la lus kyi rim gro byed pa dang / @169a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten dag la phyag ngar dang skyang nul bya ba 'bul ba dang / pha ma la lus kyi rim gro byed pa dang / mkhan po dang slob dpon dag la lus kyi rim gro byed pa dang / @169a * //
translated: to offer to the stūpas of the Tathāgatas the service of rubbing and cleaning; to serve one’s parents with one’s body; to serve one’s preceptors and teachers with one’s body;🔽to serve one’s fellow celibates with one’s body; and to do all that with a disinterested mind, not for the sake of material reward.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la lus kyi rim gro byed pa dang / de yang zang zing med pa'i sems kyis te zang zing dang bcas pas ma yin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang 'di ltar /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la lus kyi rim gro byed pa dang / de yang zang zing med pa'i sems kyis te zang zing dang bcas pas ma yin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang 'di ltar /
translated: And one dedicates the wholesome actions in this way:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad mngal gyi dri mas ma gos par skye bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo zhing de yang bsam pa thag pa nas sems pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis sems can thams cad mngal gyi dri mas ma gos par skye bar gyur cig ces yongs su bsngo zhing de yang bsam pa thag pa nas sems pa ste /
translated: ‘By this wholesome action, may all sentient beings be born unstained by the impurities of the womb.’ And one should think of this with a sincere mind.

original: rigs kyi bu chos bcu po de dag go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos bcu po de dag go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Noble sir, these are the ten.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i phan yon ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i phan yon ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs te /
translated: The benefits of rejoicing are taught in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: gang theg pa la dang po yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid /
analyzed: gang theg pa la dang po yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid /
translated: I rejoice in the arousing of the mind of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have newly entered the vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyad pa rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyad pa rnams kyi sems bskyed pa de la rjes su yi rang bar bgyid /
translated: I rejoice in the arousing of the mind of those who are practicing the conduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i chos de nyid la rjes su yi rang bar bgyis na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i chos de nyid la rjes su yi rang bar bgyis na /
translated: Having rejoiced in the very quality of irreversibility of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are irreversible,

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed cig bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed cig bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One, how much of a heap of merit will that son of family or daughter of family generate?”

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika,

original: koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni srang tshad kyis gzhal bas tshad gzung bar nus kyi /
analyzed: koo shi ka stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni srang tshad kyis gzhal bas tshad gzung bar nus kyi /
translated: Kauśika, one can measure with a scale the size of the world realm of a billion-world universe,

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag gi bsod nams ni tshad gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag gi bsod nams ni tshad gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: but, Kauśika, one cannot measure the goodness that arises from the arousing of the thought of the bodhisattva great beings’ rejoicing.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said this, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: “Lord, those beings who take up, bear in mind, read aloud, master, and properly pay attention to this perfection of wisdom—

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar la rjes su yi rang ba las skyes pa'i bsod nams 'di ltar dpag tu med do zhes bya ba mi nyan pa dang ma 'tshal ba dang rjes su yi rang
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i bar la rjes su yi rang ba las skyes pa'i bsod nams 'di ltar dpag tu med do zhes bya ba mi nyan pa dang ma 'tshal ba dang rjes su yi rang
translated: and up to the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening of full buddhahood, and the merit that arises from rejoicing in that is immeasurable.

original: bar mi bgyid pa dang mi sems pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa lags so //
analyzed: bar mi bgyid pa dang mi sems pa de dag ni bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa lags so //
translated: Those who do not listen, do not understand, do not rejoice, and do not think are blessed by Māra.

original: sems can de dag ni bdud kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba lags so //
analyzed: sems can de dag ni bdud kyi phyogs su 'gyur ba lags so //
translated: Those sentient beings will be on Māra’s side.”

original: @169b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @169b bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gis sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba de dag gis myur du de bzhin gshegs pa
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'am rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'am nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang dag gis sems bskyed pa la rjes su yi rang ba de dag gis myur du de bzhin gshegs pa
translated: “Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, in the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, or in the Śrāvaka Vehicle who rejoice in the arousing of the thought will quickly

original: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur gyi mi mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur gyi mi mnyes par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will please the arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha, and not displease him.

original: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phu dud du bya bar 'gyur bla mar bya bar 'gyur ri mor bya bar 'gyur mchod par bya bar 'gyur
analyzed: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der phu dud du bya bar 'gyur bla mar bya bar 'gyur ri mor bya bar 'gyur mchod par bya bar 'gyur
translated: “In whatever births they will have by means of those wholesome roots that have arisen from the rejoicing, they will be born with respect, with honor, with reverence, with worship,

original: rjed par 'gyur gsol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjed par 'gyur gsol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: with homage, and with offerings.

original: de dag ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not see unpleasant forms.

original: de dag ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra rnams thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra rnams thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not hear unpleasant sounds.

original: de bzhin du dri dang ro rnams ma yin zhing reg bya rnams reg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dri dang ro rnams ma yin zhing reg bya rnams reg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, they will not smell unpleasant smells, taste unpleasant tastes, or touch unpleasant textures.

original: de dag ni ngan song du skye bar mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ngan song du skye bar mi 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known that they will not be born in the lower realms.

original: de dag ni mtho ris su skye bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mtho ris su skye bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that they will be reborn in the higher realms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar sems can de dag gis sems can grangs med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can de dag thams cad la bde ba skyed pa dag la rjes su yi rang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can de dag gis sems can grangs med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sems can de dag thams cad la bde ba skyed pa dag la rjes su yi rang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because those sentient beings rejoice in the roots of virtue of countless sentient beings, which produce happiness for all those sentient beings.

original: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can grangs med pa dpag tu med pa dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems can grangs med pa dpag tu med pa dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, they will bring about the parinirvāṇa of countless, immeasurable sentient beings.

original: yang de nyid las /
analyzed: yang de nyid las /
translated: And the same text says,

original: rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na sems can gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par gyur la /
analyzed: rab 'byor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na sems can gang dag yod pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par gyur la /
translated: Subhūti, suppose that all the sentient beings that there are in the great trichiliocosm, as many as there are in the world-realms in the ten directions equal to the sands of the Ganges River, were to stand in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas nas kyang bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du dmigs pa'i 'du shes kyis ;
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas nas kyang bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du dmigs pa'i 'du shes kyis ;
translated: and having stood in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, for as many eons as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa bas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa bas /
translated: with the perception of an objective referent, they enter into the fourth concentration,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang thabs mkhas pas zin pa gang gis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang thabs mkhas pas zin pa gang gis /
translated: compared to a bodhisattva great being who, with this perfection of wisdom and with skill in means,

original: 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi @170a * //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi @170a * //
translated: has stood in the wholesome roots of the past, future, and present lord buddhas🔽and their aggregate of morality, aggregate of meditative stabilization, aggregate of wisdom, aggregate of liberation, aggregate of the knowledge and seeing of liberation, and the aggregate of the wholesome roots of pratyekabuddhas’ morality, meditative stabilization, wisdom, liberation,

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang /
translated: and knowledge and seeing of liberation,

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang / nyan thos kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang / nyan thos kyi tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: all of these are gathered together,

original: bzlums shing gzhal la /
analyzed: bzlums shing gzhal la /
translated: and are added up and measured.🔽With the supreme rejoicing in all of them without exception,

original: ma lus pa la rjes su yi rang ba'i mchog gis rjes su yi rang ba dang / gtso bo dang dam pa dang rab dang phul dang gya nom pa dang bla ma dang bla na med pa dang bla ma'i bla ma dang mnyam pa med pa dang /
analyzed: ma lus pa la rjes su yi rang ba'i mchog gis rjes su yi rang ba dang / gtso bo dang dam pa dang rab dang phul dang gya nom pa dang bla ma dang bla na med pa dang bla ma'i bla ma dang mnyam pa med pa dang /
translated: he rejoices with the best, the principal, the sublime, the excellent, the most refined, the highest, the unsurpassed, the higher than the high, the unequaled,🔽the equal of the unequaled, and the incomparable.

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang dpe zla med pas rjes su yi rang la rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang dpe zla med pas rjes su yi rang la rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
translated: And the merit that arises from that rejoicing he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po 'di la /
analyzed: rab 'byor rjes su yi rang ba'i mod las skyes pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po 'di la /
translated: Subhūti, in this merit-making wholesome action that arises from rejoicing,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa can gyi bsam gtan bzhi'i bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa can gyi bsam gtan bzhi'i bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas rgyu'i bar du yang mi bzod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: the former merit-making wholesome action of the bodhisattvas with conceptual thoughts, the four concentrations, does not approach even a hundredth part, and so on up to: it cannot bear comparison.

original: tshul 'di nyid ni yongs su bsngo ba la yang gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid ni yongs su bsngo ba la yang gsungs so //
translated: This very method is also stated in the dedication.

original: gsol ba gdab pa'i phan yon ni drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa'i phan yon ni drag shul can gyis zhus pa las /
translated: The benefits of supplicating are stated in the Questions of Ugra Sūtra:

original: chos yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhal du med grangs med pa rnams su tshe yongs su bsgyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhal du med grangs med pa rnams su tshe yongs su bsgyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to uphold the Dharma, they transform their lives in countless, immeasurable buddha-fields.

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa las phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i phan yon gyi le'u ste bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa las phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i phan yon gyi le'u ste bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: This concludes the seventeenth chapter of the Compendium of Trainings, on the benefits of prostration and so forth.

original: bzang po spyod pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsod nams 'phel bar bshad zin to /
analyzed: bzang po spyod pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsod nams 'phel bar bshad zin to /
translated: It has already been explained that the increase of merit comes from the morality of the Vows of Good Conduct, etc.

original: // /'di yang 'di'i rgyu gzhan yin te /
analyzed: // /'di yang 'di'i rgyu gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another cause of it:

original: dad pa la sogs pa rtag tu bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa rtag tu bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the constant cultivation of faith, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: As the Tathagata-Acintya-Sutra says,

original: rgyal po chen po chos bzhi po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yongs su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos bzhi po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yongs su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Great King, these four dharmas cause those who have set out in the Great Vehicle to have no backsliding and to progress.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rgyal po chen po dad pa ni yongs @170b su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po dad pa ni yongs @170b su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Great King, faith causes no backsliding and progress.

original: dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is faith?

original: dad pa gang gis 'phags pa'i drung du nye bar 'gro ba dang mi bya ba mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa gang gis 'phags pa'i drung du nye bar 'gro ba dang mi bya ba mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the faith by which one approaches the Noble Ones and does not do what should not be done.

original: rgyal po chen po gus pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po gus pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Great King, respect causes progress.

original: gus pa gang gis 'phags pa rnams kyis legs par bshad pa rnams gus par nyan pa dang rna blags te chos nyan pa'o //🔽rgyal po chen po nga rgyal med pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gus pa gang gis 'phags pa rnams kyis legs par bshad pa rnams gus par nyan pa dang rna blags te chos nyan pa'o // rgyal po chen po nga rgyal med pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Respect is the cause of progress, for it is by means of respect that one listens respectfully to the teachings of the noble ones and gives ear to the Dharma.

original: nga rgyal med pa gang gis 'phags pa rnams la mngon par 'dud pa dang rab tu 'dud pa la phyag 'tshal ba'o //🔽rgyal po chen po brtson 'grus ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa gang gis 'phags pa rnams la mngon par 'dud pa dang rab tu 'dud pa la phyag 'tshal ba'o // rgyal po chen po brtson 'grus ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Great King, absence of pride is the cause of progress, for it is by means of absence of pride that one bows down to and prostrates oneself before the noble ones.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis lus yang ba dang sems yang ba 'thob pa dang bya ba thams cad kyang nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang gis lus yang ba dang sems yang ba 'thob pa dang bya ba thams cad kyang nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa ste /
translated: Great King, diligence is the cause of progress, for it is by means of diligence that one attains lightness of body and mind and accomplishes all tasks.

original: rgyal po chen po chos bzhi po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yongs su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po chos bzhi po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yongs su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Great King, these four dharmas are the causes of progress for those who have set out in the Great Vehicle.”

original: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag la rtag tu goms par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag la rtag tu goms par bya'o //
translated: One should always cultivate these such as faith.

original: yang na dad pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la ste /
analyzed: yang na dad pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la ste /
translated: Or else, one should cultivate other such as faith.

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the noble Aksayamati Sūtra teaches,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po lnga rnams mi zad pa ste ;
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po lnga rnams mi zad pa ste ;
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the five faculties of bodhisattvas are inexhaustible.

original: de la dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbang po lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faculties?

original: gang 'di dad pa'i dbang po dang / btson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang 'di dad pa'i dbang po dang / btson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: They are the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of stable attention, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: Here, what is the faculty of faith?

original: dad pa gang gis chos bzhi la dad pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa gang gis chos bzhi la dad pa ste /
translated: It is the faith by which one has faith in four things.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'khor ba na spyod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba na spyod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad pa ste /
translated: One has faith in the right view of worldly people who experience cyclic existence.

original: de las kyi rnam par smin pa la ston pa yin /
analyzed: de las kyi rnam par smin pa la ston pa yin /
translated: One has faith in the results of evolution of evolutionary actions.

original: dge ba'am sdig pa'i las gang dang gang byas pa de dang de'i rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ro snyam ste srog gi phyir yang sdig pa'i las mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'am sdig pa'i las gang dang gang byas pa de dang de'i rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ro snyam ste srog gi phyir yang sdig pa'i las mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pa ste /
translated: They think, “Whatever virtuous or nonvirtuous karma I have created, I will experience its ripening.” They do not commit negative actions even at the cost of their lives. They have faith in the bodhisattva conduct.

original: spyod pa de la zhugs nas kyang theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa mi bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad la don dam pa nges pa'i don zab mo /
analyzed: spyod pa de la zhugs nas kyang theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa mi bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad la don dam pa nges pa'i don zab mo /
translated: Having entered that conduct, they do not give rise to desire for other vehicles. They have faith in the profound, ultimate, definitive meaning of all dharmas.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bdag med pa sems can med pa srog med pa gso ba med pa gang zag med par rnam par @171a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bdag med pa sems can med pa srog med pa gso ba med pa gang zag med par rnam par @171a * //
translated: They analyze that dependent origination is without a self, without a sentient being, without a life force, without a creature, and without a person.

original: dpyod pa dang / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du dad pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du dad pa ste /
translated: They have faith in the characteristics of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: lta bar gyur pa thams cad bag la nyal bar mi byed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad pa ste /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa thams cad bag la nyal bar mi byed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad pa ste /
translated: They do not allow any views to lie dormant. They have faith in all the buddhadharmas, such as the strengths and the fearlessnesses.

original: dad pa'i phyir the tshom dang nem nur dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag yang dag par sgrub pa ste 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i phyir the tshom dang nem nur dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag yang dag par sgrub pa ste 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of faith, one is free from doubt and uncertainty, and one accomplishes those qualities of the Buddha. This is called the faculty of faith.

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the faculty of perseverance?

original: chos gang la dad pa'i dbang pos dad par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos yang dag par sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang la dad pa'i dbang pos dad par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos yang dag par sgrub pa ste /
translated: One accomplishes those qualities in which one has faith through the faculty of perseverance.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the faculty of perseverance.

original: de la dran pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dran pa'i dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the faculty of mindfulness?

original: chos gang brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos yang dag par bsgrub pa'i chos de dag dran pa'i dbang pos chud mi gson te /
analyzed: chos gang brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos yang dag par bsgrub pa'i chos de dag dran pa'i dbang pos chud mi gson te /
translated: One does not lose those qualities that one accomplishes through the faculty of perseverance.

original: 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the faculty of mindfulness.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the faculty of concentration?

original: dran pa'i dbang pos chos gang chud mi gson pa'i chos de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rtse gcig tu byed de /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang pos chos gang chud mi gson pa'i chos de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rtse gcig tu byed de /
translated: One unifies those qualities that one does not lose through the faculty of mindfulness.

original: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the faculty of meditative concentration.

original: de la shes rab kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi dbang po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the faculty of wisdom?

original: chos gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rtse gcig tu byas pa'i chos de dag shes rab kyi dbang pos rab tu rtog cing shin tu rtog par byed de /
analyzed: chos gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rtse gcig tu byas pa'i chos de dag shes rab kyi dbang pos rab tu rtog cing shin tu rtog par byed de /
translated: The faculty of wisdom fully investigates and fully discerns those things that the faculty of meditative concentration makes one-pointed.

original: gang chos de dang de dag la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par shes shing so sor rang gis shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang chos de dang de dag la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par shes shing so sor rang gis shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the wisdom that does not depend on others, the wisdom that is one’s own.

original: de ltar na dbang po lnga po 'di dag ni lhan cig tu 'grogs shing rjes su 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po lnga po 'di dag ni lhan cig tu 'grogs shing rjes su 'brel ba ste /
translated: In this way, these five faculties accompany and follow each other.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do ;
translated: They bring to completion all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: / lung bstan pa'i sar yang gzhog go zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: / lung bstan pa'i sar yang gzhog go zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: They lead to the stage of prophecy.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs rnams la yang rtag tu goms par bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs rnams la yang rtag tu goms par bya ste /
translated: You should always practice the powers of faith and so on.

original: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: As the noble Sūtra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head says,

translated: The bodhisattva should practice the Dharma in order to be in the sphere of the Dharma, to rely on the Dharma, to be devoted to the Dharma, to make the Dharma his essence, and to accomplish the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //

analyzed: chos ni mthon dman med pas chos ni rgya che ba la 'jug pa ma yin dman pa la 'jug pa ma yin te //

analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang mthun pa'i sems su bya'o //

analyzed: chos ni mchog dang tha ma dang bral bas chos ni rnam par dag pa la yang 'jug pa ma yin nyams pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin te /

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: Thus, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: Thus, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

analyzed: chos ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas chos ni nyin mo 'jug pa ma yin mtshan mo 'jug pa ma yin /
translated: The Dharma is always and constantly engaged, so the Dharma does not engage during the day and not engage at night.

original: mtshan mo 'jug la nyin mo mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan mo 'jug la nyin mo mi 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not engage at night and not engage during the day.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

analyzed: chos ni gang la yang nam yang sdod pa ma yin pas chos ni 'dul ba'i dus las kyang mi 'da' ste /
translated: The Dharma never stops for anyone at any time, so the Dharma does not pass beyond the time for taming.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni @174b thams cad du 'dod pa med pas chos ni sdang ba rnams la zhe 'gras pa yang med dad pa rnams la rjes su chags pa yang med de /
analyzed: chos ni @174b thams cad du 'dod pa med pas chos ni sdang ba rnams la zhe 'gras pa yang med dad pa rnams la rjes su chags pa yang med de /
translated: The Dharma has no desire for anything, so the Dharma is not hostile to those who are hostile and is not attached to those who have faith.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.

original: chos ni bri ba yang ma yin gang ba yang ma yin te dpag tu med grangs med pas nam mkha' ltar 'bri ba yang ma yin 'phel ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ni bri ba yang ma yin gang ba yang ma yin te dpag tu med grangs med pas nam mkha' ltar 'bri ba yang ma yin 'phel ba yang ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma is not diminished and is not filled up. It is not diminished and does not increase like space, which is immeasurable and beyond number.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

analyzed: chos ni sems can rnams kyis srung ba ma yin gyi chos kyis sems can rnams srung ba ste /
translated: The Dharma does not protect sentient beings; rather, sentient beings are protected by the Dharma.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

analyzed: chos ni thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas chos ni gang la yang thogs pa med de /
translated: The Dharma is not obstructed by anything, because it is characterized by the absence of obstruction.

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

original: chos ni bag la nyal med pas bag la nyal mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos ni bag la nyal med pas bag la nyal mi 'jug ste /

original: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o //
translated: I too should have a mind like the Dharma.

analyzed: de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o snyam mo //
translated: In the same way, I too should have a mind that is like the Dharma.
